title: Alibates Flint Quarries National Monument: Be A Junior Ranger
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth     Be A Junior Ranger              Be A Junior Ranger         Junior Ranger high achiever at Alibates Flint Quarries National Monument Contact Station NPS Photo  Junior rangers are important people. They help park rangers protect plants, animals, rocks, and historic sites. They pick up litter and put it in trash cans. Junior Rangers know that national parks are special places that need to be protected so they will be just as special in the future. Would you like to be a Junior Ranger at Alibates Flint Quarries National Monument and Lake Meredith National Recreation Area? Pick up a booklet at park headquarters or the Alibates contact station or download the link below and complete the activities in your age group. When you are finished, take the booklet back so a park ranger can check your answers and issue you a Junior Ranger badge. Download Junior Ranger Book.  Â   Now you can be a Junior Ranger even if you are not able to visit a national park. Log on to WebRangers and you can become a member of a growing group of young people who are interested in the world around them and are involved with their nation's heritage!
